704778f-c.text:
Hamilton Avenue, at the N. E. corner of 15th Street, showing John M. Eelleher's scrap metal yard. Improvements were later made here when the ares became part of the northerly extension of the
Belt Parkway. The gas tank is at 13th Street.
July 25, 1940

704769f-b.text:
Hamilton Avenue, at the S.E. corner of Second Avenue. These buildings were later torn down for the construction of Gowanus Expressway, Brooklyn's northerly extension of the
Belt Parkway system of highways.
View 2 shows the same corner with the buildings down.
View 1: JUly 26, 1940
View 2: 0ctober 17, 1940
P. L. Sperr

704777f-b.text:
Hamilton Avenue, east side, north from Second Avenue to 15th Street, showing the area after the buildings that stood here were demolished for the widening of the avenue. Gowanus Parkway, Brooklyn's northerly extension of the Belt Farkway, was later constructed here. The gas tank is on
13th Street. 7ew w w. '-S~Ae NS 9 92E.
VN.w : October 17, 1940
P. L. Sperr  Www .2E.2 23, 59
